text: The human <extra_id_0> myeloid nuclear differentiation antigen <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> MNDA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) is expressed specifically in maturing cells of the myelomonocytic lineage and in monocytes and granulocytes .

Epitope enhancement was used to confirm the strict lineage - and stage - specific expression of <extra_id_0> MNDA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in bone marrow as well as in other paraffin-embedded fixed tissues .

A 1-kb region of the gene that includes 5 ' flanking sequence was reported earlier to contain functional promoter activity and was specifically demethylated in expressing cells in contrast to null cells .

Further analysis has revealed that this 1-kb fragment promotes higher reporter gene activity in <extra_id_0> MNDA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - expressing cells than non-expressing cells , indicating cell - specific differences in transactivation .

text: This sequence contains consensus elements consistent with myeloid - specific gene expression , including a <extra_id_0> PU.1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> consensus site near the major transcription start site and a cluster of <extra_id_0> c-Myb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> sites located several hundred bases upstream of this region .

However , analysis of deletion mutants localized nearly all of the promoter activity to a short region ( -73 to -16 ) that did not include the cluster of <extra_id_0> c-Myb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> sites .
A 4-bp mutation of the core <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> consensus element ( GC box ) ( -20 ) reduced overall promoter activity of the 1-kb fragment .
Mutation of the <extra_id_0> PU.1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> site did not significantly affect promoter activity .

Only a small region ( -35 to +22 ) including the <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> element and transcription start site , but not the <extra_id_0> PU.1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> site was footprinted .

The 4-bp mutation of the core <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> consensus element abolished footprinting at the site and an antibody super - shift reaction showed that <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is one of the factors binding the consensus site .
The <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> site also co - localizes with a DNase I hypersensitive site .

The results indicate that DNA methylation , chromatin structure , and transactivation at an <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> site contribute to the highly restricted expression of this myelomonocytic lineage specific gene .
